report.summary: My caches - inconsistent display behavior
report.label: None yet
report.description: By default, I have c:geo hide found caches. There is a recently introduced bug which causes this to work sporadically. In some cases, previously foudn caches are displayed. When zooming in/out, sometime previously foudn caches will appear/disappear. The problem is intermittent - sorry I cannot provide more concrete details.

report.summary: Saved caches map becomes live map
report.label: None yet
report.description: When viewing the list of saved caches and clicking view map, the map view loads non-saved caches. To reproduce: Save a few caches. From the main menu click "Stored" Click the map icon on the upper edge. The map now contains caches that are not in the stored cache list.

report.summary: Caches dissappear from map if zoomed out far enough.
report.label: None yet
report.description: In map view (both live map, map of stored caches and map of individual caches) all cache icons disappear if the zoom level is low enough. The caches appear at first, but disappear once the search indicator in the upper right hand corner disappears. This could make sense in live map, where one does not want to load every cache in the whole world if one zooms out to view the entire world, but this is not what's going on here, as it also affects the stored cache and individual cache maps, and caches that are already loaded also disappear.

report.summary: Found and owned caches appear in live map.
report.label: None yet
report.description: When using the live map, caches that I own or have already found appear in the map, even though I have opted to hide them. Steps to reproduce: In the settings, select "Exclude own and found caches". From the main menu, select "Live map". Disable follow position (optional). Scroll to an area where you have found or own caches. What should happen: Caches you own or have found should not appear. What does happen: All caches, including caches you have found or own, appear. After loading is complete, the found and owned caches disappear. If the map is moved (triggering a new search) the caches temporarily re-appear.

report.summary: adjust compass sensitivity / invoke GPS Status
report.label: None yet
report.description: GPS accuracy on some android devices can be improved a lot by dampening GPS coordinates. the free app "GPS status" by EclipSim allows four levels of filtering, none, weak, medium, strong. When switching from weak to medium on my Galaxy S I9000, the GPS accuracy improved considerably. The downside is that it takes longer to react. But when navigating only a few meters in search for a cache, I prefer accuracy over speed. Maybe it would even be possible to use GPS Status / Radar to navigate to caches in addition to the builtin compass?

report.summary: GPX Import - specified or selectable folder instead of searching the whole sd card
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have many folders on my sd card. The time for searching the gpx files for import is greater then 10 minutes. Is it possible to specify a folder for the import. Or would it be possible to make ist selectable? Thanks for your work! Greeting luckyloser

report.summary: Release planning?
report.label: None yet
report.description: First and foremost: I don't want to introduce any unnecessary formalism. And I strongly believe in "Release early, release often". Nevertheless I wanted to ask if we are going to have some kind of planned (or expected) releases. For instance last week a new release was created on Friday, so that all cachers would be able to use the new version over the weekend. I'm mainly asking because I refactored all the code relating to calling external applications (navigation, maps, ...) which led to a lot of changes. And I just want to know when will be a good time to release large changes (which may introduce new bugs, even if you do a lot of testing beforehand). Currently I will hold back my changes until the weekend is nearly over, assuming that releasing on Sunday evening will have the smallest impact, if any bugs slipped through. BTW: Would something like this better be discussed in the wiki? I have never worked with GitHubs wiki before.

report.summary: exception in map file name settings
report.label: None yet
report.description: On a completely new device I just had an exception caused by a null map file name. This name is then used by mapforge to verify it as a valid file name. I was able to work around that issue with commit bf92bf3. Nevertheless someone with more experience in the map code should verify that the default value null for the map file name doesn't cause other problems, as I don't really know the remaining map code. From the commit history it looks like a user "Rainer" added the mapsforge implementation, but I don't find an assignee with that username.

report.summary: Visit all trackables oddity...
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm not sure if something can be easily done about this. It's not a big deal, but I figured I'd toss it out there. The new feature to make trackables visited in the setup is wonderful, however, when logging a Will attend, DNF, write note, etc, it still visits all the trackables. I'm sure most folk only visit their trackables on a found log. Is it possible to revert the trackables to do nothing when the log type is changed? If not, it's no big deal. Since 99% of my logs are found it, it's not anything major to have to manually change it on the few other logs. Thanks!

report.summary: Manual waypoint modifications are lost by Refresh
report.label: None yet
report.description: Especially for Mystery and Multicaches the listings sometimes contain waypoints without coordinates. When I find out the coordinates for the stages/finals I modify the waypoints in c:geo (I enter the coordinates and I add some variable values, ... to the waypoint description). But when I refresh the data in c:geo, my modifications are LOST !!! :-( IMO nothing entered by the user should ever get lost: Not by Refresh, not by GPX import not by anything else. IMO these modifications should even be stored independently of whether the cache itself ist stored for offline use or not.

report.summary: send-to-c:geo vs. chrome-to-phone
report.label: None yet
report.description: What can be done with send-to-c:geo that could not be done with chrome-to-phone (or fox-to-phone for Firefox users)? I ask because I'm a firm believer in "remove code as much as you can to get a maintainable application" and am under the impression that it duplicates the functionality in a less general way (chrome-to-phone uses push notifications). The only difference I see is that people do have to have a Google account to use chrome-to-phone, but I bet this is the case for 99,9% of our Android users.

report.summary: logging wrong order?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Huh? I just tried C:geo extensively. I found 4 caches, and did not find 2. I logged through c:geo on site. In other words, right after the find (or not) I logged in C:geo, and sent the log. The logging order should be 1: @ 14:10 2: @ 14:45 3: @ 14:55 4: @ 15:25 5: @ 15:35 6: @ 15:45 yet in actuallity the logs are sorted like so: 1: @ 14:45 (found) 2: @ 15:25 (not found) 3: @ 15:35 (found) 4: @ 15:45 (not found) 5: @ 14:10 (found) 6: @ 14:55 (found) (going UP in recent logs). It is as if c:geo "held on" to my logs before sending them? Any clues how this could happen? It is frustrating like H*l when you do multiple searches / finds / not founds in a day.

report.summary: Link from "Locus" POI's to c:geo cache details not working with caches from restored DB
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi. When switching from old c:geo to c:geo opensource, I did a backup/restore of my data. For lots of those caches (Mystery Finals mainly) i stored POIs in Locus. As you may know, Locus provides an POI option to directly switch back to the c:geo cache details after a POI has been created from "c:geo->Show on Map->Locus". This is working for new stored caches, but not with the ones that have been imported. Locus even throws an exception. The last entry from the stack trace reads: "ActivityNotFoundException: Unable to find explicit activity class {carnero.cgeo/carnero.cgeo.cgeodetail}; have you declared this activity in your AndroidManifest.xml?" Any idea why this isn't working? Did Locus have some kind of old reference thats not working after re-import of the caches? Or isn't c:geo opensource accepting the "old" references at all? Incompatible? TIA, Rev

report.summary: Tweaking the action bars
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've been working on small tweaks to the user interface as I get comfortable with c:geo's source code. Now I wanted to work a bit on the action bars. I realize that aesthetics vary from person to person, so I wanted to reach some agreement before I put in the work. Essentially, I wanted to retouch a few spots to bring the action bars closer to the Android standard, if you can call it that -- everyone seems to implement their action bars slightly differently, but there are a few common points. The tone is more or less set by the Google I/O app which is supposed to be the gold standard for Android UI patterns: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.google.android.apps.iosched I think that we should follow those patterns as well. Anyway, my proposals: Make the vertical separator cover the whole height of the action bar (so that the action buttons really look like buttons); Add a separator currently missing in the leftmost button in the right group, for example, in http://cgeo.org/content/images/screenshots/s2.png the map button should have a separator on the left; Remove the separator paddings to make the buttons look square instead of rectangular, with the benefit that we win a bit of horizontal space Remove the separator next to the c:geo icon in the main activity I can do this myself, and in fact already started, but as I said, I wanted to get your agreement before changing the action bars in every activity.

report.summary: Deleting many caches from lists is slow / list "flickers" in background
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi. I just deleted about 30 caches from a list and noticed that its pretty slow. The list below the progress dialog is updating after every change (for each cache being removed). Maybe thats part of the problem. It would be better to "freeze" the the list and update it once after the operation finished. Rev

report.summary: Support also OruxMaps
report.label: None yet
report.description: "Navigate" - "Show on external map" leads to "Locus" and to "Google Maps" and to "Radar and Navigation" but not to "Orux Maps" (although it is installed). It seems, that the used Intent "com.robert.maps.action.SHOW_POINTS" is a very specific one. Isn't there any generally supported Intent for this purpose?

report.summary: list
report.label: None yet
report.description: please close this... For some reason I made a doublepost.

report.summary: Show on map when viewing list should only display caches in that list.
report.label: None yet
report.description: This would be a major improvement in areas with many caches.

report.summary: GPS only activated when needed
report.label: None yet
report.description: I think it would be helpful if the GPS is only activated when needed e.g. when you navigate on map or search for caches nearby. Turning GPS off by default will save battery of the device. What do you think about this?

report.summary: Even show offline caches in the live map
report.label: None yet
report.description: It could be an option and it helps when geocaching offline

report.summary: Provide a light compass view to save battery
report.label: None yet
report.description: It could be drawn just with a simple direction arrow + North-South direction arrow Current text information should be the same (sat, approx, distance, etc.) Even the update interval could be set slower (it could be an option: max, 1sec, 2sec, 5sec, etc.) All this could help save battery life.

report.summary: Cache filter switch on main page should be inclusive tick boxes, not radio buttons
report.label: None yet
report.description: There should be an option of including several types of caches in search and live maps and what have you. Currently it's either all types or just one type. This filter should be modifiable for a single search instance w/o affecting the "normal" choice.

report.summary: Replace actionbar background bitmap with XML
report.label: None yet
report.description: The action bar background bitmap (actionbar_background_tile.png) appears 4 times in the project, one for each DPI level and an extra default. Since the background is just a simple gradient, it can be replaced by an XML shape drawable. This change alone will immediately shave around 80KB off the apk. The only possible issue is that on close inspection the background bitmap has a subtle "roughness" to it which I can't tell if it's by design or result of image compression.

report.summary: move readme and buildnotes into readme.md
report.label: None yet
report.description: We should put the contents of readme and buildnotes together into one file readme.md. That file is then displayed with markup directly on the cgeo source page on github. For an example have a look at the contents of https://github.com/infinitest/infinitest (below the source list). Everything you see there is a simple text file at https://raw.github.com/infinitest/infinitest/master/README.md

report.summary: Remove drawable-mdpi folder
report.label: None yet
report.description: The drawable-mdpi only contains files which are duplicate from the ones in drawable. This is because Android 1.5 uses mdpi resolution and isn't able to find the mdpi folder, so all of its images need to be in drawable. As it is, it makes no sense to keep the drawable-mdpi folder around. It's making the program file bigger with zero benefit.

report.summary: Hint already decoded by default
report.label: None yet
report.description: On nighty 1709 the cache hint is already shown decoded when opening cache details. Sorry, could not test with market version right now.

report.summary: storing just viewed cache: why the online wait again
report.label: None yet
report.description: I quite often store a cache for offline use after just looking at it, and every time c:geo seems to need to download the cache again! I wonder why that is, as it has just downloaded the same info and should still hold it (after all the cache is still displayed!). Sometimes that second download can take a while and is annoying.

report.summary: Can't login on the Galaxy Tab (HC3.1)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi. After update 17 sep login doesn't work. I try install new update morning today (18 sep), but that update no fix my problem. c:geo just say: "Sorry can't login..." Best Regards Kazeasch (tested in Czech Republic. Sorry for my English)

report.summary: Locus issues: live map not Locus? Locus pro not found?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have the latest (18.09.2011) c:geo and Locus Pro installed. The Live map is not using Locus? Is that intended? Also, when I select 'menu: Utility programs' it does not find Locus Pro, only Locus Free (offers it for download). Should it not tell me that I have Locus Pro installed and use that?

report.summary: Downloading a PQ to a list, cgeo should place all PQ caches in new list
report.label: None yet
report.description: Downloading a PQ to a list, cgeo should place all PQ caches in new list, and not exclude already stored caches.

report.summary: Allow caches to be in several lists at once
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently, caches can only be in a single list. This seems unnecessarily restrictive. I understand this might require a redesign of the list implementation, but the current one seems sluggish. Lists should only have references to caches, not store the caches.

report.summary: Caches owned or found flicker on/off at random on live map
report.label: None yet
report.description: With "Don't show found or owned caches" set, in live map, found / owned caches flicker on and off, seemingly at random. Activate Live/Inactivate Live merely changes precisely which caches flicker or disappear or show up, and not in any rational way. Seemingly. There's probably a very predictable mechanism at work, but I cannot see what the misbehaviour depends on. "flicker" is triggered by Time, wait long enough and caches will disappear or reappear Moving, move the map so that a cache site gets inside the map area shown and you get flicker all over, If a found cache is shown, looking at the description shows no "Found" label.

report.summary: Possibility to attach / take a photo when logging visit
report.label: None yet
report.description: In the logging dialog you have the possibility to attach e.g. date, time, cache number... => Would be nice if there is an option to attach (or take) (multiple) photos to a log entry.

report.summary: Add support for Freemap.sk maps
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello Please add support for the following Freemap.sk maps: hiking (T) cycling (C) transport (A) TMS description: http://wiki.freemap.sk/LayerAllInOne (please use Google Translate to read it in your language or ask me for help in case of problems). Thanks in advance.

report.summary: GCVote not shown
report.label: None yet
report.description: GCVote is not shown directly in nearby-list. Only after opening a Cache it shows the color-code for the voting for this cache in the list after closing it again. Version: 24/09/2011

report.summary: c:geo is not available on android 1.6
report.label: None yet
report.description: Can not find c:geo opensurce in phone market and can not get new updates. And its missing in myapps. can you fix it?

report.summary: Difficult to open go4cache info when using OSM
report.label: None yet
report.description: When I try to click on a go4cache icon (red dot) on the live-map while using OSM it is very difficult to get the info-window open. Doing the same while Google Maps is active is much easier (as it should be). It is like the accepted radius for tapping on the screen is much lower when OSM is displayed. Happens with OSM:Mapnik and OSM:Offline. Works OK with Google:Map. Others not tested. Regards, Lineflyer

report.summary: "Link" to GPS status from quick info popup
report.label: None yet
report.description: Feature request: It would be nice the have a button that directly opens GPS status (could be hidden if app is not installed) next to the Compass-Button on the live maps cache popup window.

report.summary: Forwarding OC-caches not possible
report.label: None yet
report.description: When selecting "Forward" (Weiterleiten) from cache-detail of an OC-cache it translates to http://coord.info/OCxxxx which of course is not working with non-gc caches. It should be changed e.g. to plain-text like "Cache OCxxxx on Opencaching". Or does OC have such kind of short-URL function ?

report.summary: Mark as Found
report.label: None yet
report.description: It would be great, having a function "mark as found" - similar to "field notes" but without typing text on the road. Simply press menu -> mark as found... and when at home -> export all "marked" GC-Numbers e.g. to a txt or html file which contains links direct to the Listings (or to the Log-Page of the Listings)

report.summary: Contributor's name
report.label: None yet
report.description: As discussed with Samuel, i'd like to change my name in contributors for my real name : Instead "ludoo0d0a (localization FR)", please write this : Ludovic Valente (localization FR) Thanks

report.summary: cgeo fails to log me in to GC.com. Official app works.
report.label: None yet
report.description: Suddenly cgeo starts failing to log in on GC.com. The official gc app works fine. The login procedure reports Unknown error.... I don't know where else to report this. I tried reentering the login data, but nogo. Groundspeak's own app works fine, provably.

report.summary: No terrain rating showing up since update
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since 6/10 update, the terrain rating has disappeared from the cache listing page. Here's a screen shot. http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v665/damnedrodan/100_4815.jpg

report.summary: remove multiple progress dialogs
report.label: None yet
report.description: The cache details activity has 6 (!!!) different progress dialogs as fields. I'd like to completely remove those and instead have one progress dialog wrapper class which internally manages one progress dialog, but takes away all the resource management. The only open question I have: Is it possible to have multiple progress dialogs shown concurrently in Android? And if so, does that make sense? Do we use something like that somewhere? I'm asking because I would like to write that wrapper in such a way, that there can be only one progress dialog at any time. Simplifies things a lot.

report.summary: FC when opening a cache from link
report.label: None yet
report.description: I opened a cache from link on very low 3G signal. From log it seems that c:geo did not log in successfully but it should not FC. Current release branch. report.summary: support locationless caches fully or not at all
report.label: None yet
report.description: We have no type for locationless caches in our cache type enumeration. But we have icons for them (and put them in the icon lookup maps). We should either remove them completely or support them fully. Which way to go?

report.description: When opening the cache-details (from live-map or nearby) the progress dialog (Loading page...Loading Logs, etc.) is no longer shown. The page is just empty unitll the details appear.

report.summary: "/" in username is problematic
report.label: None yet
report.description: A minor bug: If a gc username contains the "/" sign it is not possible to use "Hide Caches/Found Caches" function after clicking the username. Reproduce: Open details for GC1ZXEZ Click on owner field You will see "%2f" instead of "/" in the header of the popup (this will be the problem) Inside the log area the function is OK.

report.summary: Insert template for GCvote rating and Favourite point to signature
report.label: None yet
report.description: The title says it all. Thx

report.summary: Scan QR code
report.label: None yet
report.description: What is the reason to have this "feature" in Geocaching application?

report.summary: Smiley not given to found cache :(
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have found several caches and submitted my find online. When I look at a live map it does not give me the smiley face. If you click on the cache and open it - it will say found - and my log post is there. Why am I not getting the smiley face? I keep going to a bunch of caches thinking I have them to do - but in fact when I open the cache - then realize I have found it already. Am I doing something wrong? Also, since I am new to the geocaching thing - perhaps most of this is my fault? Why when I try and log a find online (using my Moto Droid) SOMETIMES - it says the cache is not available and it will only let me SAVE for offline use? Also - last question -- I just did my first "series". Is there a way to change the coordinates on my gps? Example -- had to find 7 caches - each had a clue to the GPS coordinates of the FINAL CACHE. Using C:Geo -- is there a way that I can enter those coordinates AFTER I found them all? Again using the Motorola Droid - the c:geo is my ONLY source of navigation/GPS. This app is AWESOME!!! I love it - just not sure if its me or is there something wrong?

report.summary: Refactor cgCache
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'd like to refactor cgCache. First I'd like to change the direct access of the members into getters and setters method calls. Second, I'd like to introduce a class hierachy. An interface "ILogable" with basic operations for all kind of caches, trackables, challenges. Different implementations like GCCache, Trackable, OCCache, Challenge and so on. Your opinion on that ?

report.summary: Opening certain TB leads to crash
report.label: None yet
report.description: In general the TB view is OK, however trying to open TB14WFV leads to a crash. Nightly 2110 commit 6e41b6f No log at the moment but should be reproducible

report.summary: FC when selecting "Show on Map"
report.label: None yet
report.description: NB 2310 -ab0e4b1: If I am in compass mode and select "Show on map" c:geo crashes and goes back to cache-details. It is reproducible on my device. If it not reproducible on your side, I can provide a log later.

report.summary: Progress bar shows wrong progress when importing gpx with waypoints
report.label: None yet
report.description: When a gpx file from a pocket query is imported that has a waypoints file attached, the progress bar shows correct progress for importing the cache file, wrong progress for the waypoints file and no progress for storing the caches in DB. Reason is that the progress bar is initialized once with the size of the cache file in cgeogpxes but not updated later for the import of the waypoints file or when storing the caches. Control is handed over to GPXParser that doesn't know about the progress bar. My proposal is to put control over file handling and storing of caches into cgeogpxes and remove it from GPXParser. GPXParser gets rid of all the static methods and provides only: Collection parse(InputStream, Handler) Simple API, nicely testable. Ok, LocParser would need some more rework. This refactoring would also make it easier to add support for importing pocket query zips directly. What do you think?

report.summary: TestCase cgeaApplicationTest.testSearchTrackable fails
report.label: None yet
report.description: The tested TB moved one. Can we make this more robust against further changes or do we have a static trackable we can use here? Perhaps TBWDQH?

report.label: None yet
report.description: Can't install the aplication, I'm using CM7 V1.1 with Android VS 2.3.7 and it says that my phone isn't compatible with C:Geo can you please check it out? Or is the version of C:Geo not compatible with 2.3.7? Thank you,

report.summary: Live map shows stored caches only
report.label: None yet
report.description: It seems that the behaviour of the live map has changed recentöy: It shows only the stored caches. It shows found caches although I selected "Exclude own and found caches".

report.summary: specify import directories
report.label: None yet
report.description: it is really disconcerting to have c:geo search my whole Android every time I am trying to import a GPX file. Not only does that take much time, but it also finds GPX files from other applications. You should really add a preference/setting which directories it should look into for imports (and default that to one sane choice)

report.summary: Make premium caches distinguishable from normal ones (live map and lists)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi there. Last weekend i was caching with someone who doesn't have a premium account. There was a lot confusion about where to go next, because she wasn't seeing the premium caches on the map at all and I wasn't able to take into consideration what caches we should/could skip because they all look the same. Regards, Rev

report.summary: gc.com downtime notifications
report.label: None yet
report.description: Gc.com has downtime almost weekly. When using cgeo it is very easy to not see gc.com notifications. I would like to see a feature where cgeo detects the yellow notification bar and show it as a dialog.

report.summary: "Hidden by" search crashes c:geo
report.label: None yet
report.description: NB 1211-1ECC184 Trying to search with username for owned caches crashes c:geo reproducibly on my devices. Market version seems ok. If its not reproducible I can provide a log later.

report.summary: Coordinates input problematic with Swype keyboard
report.label: None yet
report.description: (Using NB1311- 01a6ad6) After updating my phone (Samsung Galaxy SII) to Android 2.3.4 I have a strange problem: When using the coordinates input (e.g. by "Any destination") with the input helper (format: DDD MM.MMM) all the fields are preselected on access as usual. This means when I start typing the previous content is replaced by the numbers I enter. This is still working normal in all fields except for the MM input of longitude: After entering the DDD information the focus jumps to the MM field and the content is preselected normally, but if I input some digits they are just appended to the exisiting digits. The MMM field is again working normal. The strange thing is, that if I selected the android default keyboard instead of the Swype keyboard it is working normal again. Now you could say, that this is a pure Samsung-Swype problem, but I found out the following: If I use the latest market version (instead of the NB mentioned above) the behaviour changes a little bit. With this version the same problem also occurs in the MM field of the latitude (North/south) coordinates. This field was OK in the NB-version. This brings me to the conclusion that the problem is based by the Swype-keyboard but also somehow related to a programming issue. I hope you can follow my explanations...it is a little hard to describe the problem.

report.summary: C:geo using geocaching.com live api or scraping?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Is c:geo using groundspeak's public api or is it just scraping the webpage? Seemingly, the api avoids problems like the sudden login procedure changes.

report.summary: Using slippy tiles cache (of OsmAnd f.eg.)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Is it possible to use a tile cache shared by other apps, like OsmAnd ? It is in slippy format: /zoom/x/y.png Would be great to avoid redundance, and allow easier hunting without connection.

report.summary: Rotating the Map views does not recalculate the bounding box for showing markers
report.label: None yet
report.description: This seems to be a regression: if I rotate my Galaxy 7" Tab (Android 2.2) after I've opened one of the map views the bounding box for showing markers will be wrong. It doesn't seem to get updated, this the map will contain an area where it lacks markers albeit there should be markers shown. Note: only tested with OSM offline maps.

report.summary: Logging not possible
report.label: None yet
report.description: In NB 1411 the logview is always showing"Logging not possible". Only after switching from Found to other log type and back again its normal. I did not log a cache up to now but at least the prompt is wrong in log view. Is this a new feature ?

report.summary: Login data required for offline log?
report.label: None yet
report.description: It is obviously not possible to do an offline log if no login data is given (the whole log-menu is missing). That sounds strange to me. Is there a reason? The logic for adding (offline) log menu entries is in class "ActivityMixin" in function "addVisitMenu".

report.summary: GC/QR code scan activity should have an action bar like all other activities
report.label: None yet
report.description: A small feature request for consistent user experience: if possible, the code scan activity should have an action bar like all other c:geo activities. In this case, the action bar should contain the home and help actions.

report.summary: Change behaviour of "Logging not possible" prompt
report.label: None yet
report.description: Last days the check for being online in log-view has been introduced. Since I am using the corresponding nightlies I recognized that the log-view shows "Logging not possible" for some time (depends on network speed: WLAN 1-2 seconds, 3G up to 10 seconds) unitl the network-status is known and only then changes to the normal "Log"). In order to avoid user complaints and misunderstandings I would suggest to show the normal "Log" at first and only change to "Logging not possible" after it has been detected that the network is not available.

Of course it should not get so small that users can not easily tap it, but right now its a really big section for each TB.

The login check is unreliable. My unit is an HTC Wildfire using Android 2.2.1

report.summary: Rotating OSM map FC
report.label: None yet
report.description: When I navigate to cache using some OSM map, tha acticity FC with following logcat: E/AndroidRuntime(15206): FATAL EXCEPTION: Overlay E/AndroidRuntime(15206): java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: bitmap size exceeds VM budget E/AndroidRuntime(15206): at android.graphics.Bitmap.nativeCreate(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime(15206): at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:477) E/AndroidRuntime(15206): at org.mapsforge.android.maps.Overlay.run(Overlay.java:215) It doesn't happen with Google maps. And sometimes, it need to be rotated twice, before the FC. As I see the stacktrace, there is not much you can do, since it's probably bug in mapsforge.

report.summary: Logout / wrong position
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am beginning to feel that this problem is unique to me... I launched c:geo today after not having used ti for several days. It appeared that we were still logged in. I was having some issues getting a 3G connection, so I rebooted my phone. after that, I launched c:geo and logged in. Everything worked just fine as we found our first cache of the day. We then drove, about 10 minutes, to a second cache. When we got there, I launched c:geo and we were logged out. I know this happened because a) the locations of the caches 'jumped' and b) a nearby cache we had found no longer showed the smiley. I again logged in, and after a minute or so, the smiley reappeared. What happened next, however, was truly strange. We found the cache using the map view/google satellite. The location of the cache appeared to be within 5 meters of our location as shown in the map. However, the cache information page indicated that the cache was 30+ meters away. I then used a separate program to grab the current GPS location. Using a distance calculator showed that the GPS location was within 8 meters of the cache location. So, why did the info page indicate the distance was 30+ meters even though the location was properly displayed on the map?

report.summary: Crash in Nightly (26.12.)
report.label: None yet
report.description: When i click on the List-Button, the Software crashes. I have the Version from 17. December, there are no Problems with it. I dont have more Information, sorry!

report.summary: Edited WPs are overwritten by CacheUpdate
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am not sure, whether it is intended to work in that way: Today I did GC1Z71W. This cache has 10 waypoints (Stages of a Multi Cache). For all of them I added the coordinates in c:geo as I found them. Now I updated the cache-details and found, that all my modified waypoints are again replaced by the waypoints from gc.com (with empty coordinates). I think, this should not happen as the user might loose coordinates he needs for completing a multi-cache he already started, and I am quite sure that the behavior was different in older versions ?! I am using the RC-version downloaded 23.12.2011.

report.summary: Switch between map and compass
report.label: None yet
report.description: I recently figured out that one can switch the default view to a map view when clicking on the navigate button in the overlay / details view. Thats fine and all, I usually use GMaps Terrain for a better overview where a cache is placed, but occasionally I still use the simple compass. Now when I set any map as default view, I apparently cannot switch back to the compass view, but I can reach any map view through the compass. It would be cool if the other way would work as well...

report.summary: Modified coordinates revert back to original sometimes
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have seen this issue several times, but can not clearly say, under which condition it happens: I have a list containing my solved mysteries (where I have modified coordinates on gc.com). Initially they were all correctly stored (modified coordinates as cache-coordinates + additional waypoint with original coordinates). After some days I access the list again and find that the cache-coordinates are back to the original coordinates, and only after updating the caches from web again they are OK. My first assumption was, that if the caches are loaded on live-map (which might be the case), they are somehow overwritten by the original-coordinates. However I tried to reproduce this and I can see, that the cache-icon is shown on the wrong geolocation on live-map (the original coordinates) but after this the saved version was still OK. So two questions: Is it a limit of gc.com, that the coordinates on live-map are not my modified coordinates ? Might this cause the cache-coordinates to be reverted back to original in the saved-list ? Edit: Latest NB as well as new Market Release.

I could open the waypoint but had no knowledge about the geocache it belongs to. It would be nice to be able to change to the geocache details view from the waypoint view.

report.summary: Calendar add on does not properly exit
report.label: None yet
report.description: If the finish() call is removed from the onCreate method, which it must be because onCreate will continue executing while the dialog is being shown, then it must be added for positive and negative outcomes of the dialog. Steps to reproduce (after removing finish() from onCreate): View an event cache Click menu and then Add to calendar Click Back arrow Click menu again. Nothing will happen because the add on is still running, just without any window showing. Hitting back a second time will return control to c:geo. I will submit a pull request to fix this.

report.summary: Improve default navigation to support a second tool
report.label: None yet
report.description: As already mentioned in the initial disscussion of #868 most users not only have one preferred navigation tool. It's the same for me and i was looking for a solution that doesn't pollute the menus nor the action bar, but enables fast access to a second navigation tool. My proposal is to add a second preference for such a second tool. Just a short text explaining how to access it and a spinner to choose the tool like for the first one. Access to the tool is only available via long click at the action bar navigation icon wherever it exists. Currently this will be in the cache details, cache popup (from map) and the waypoint activity. I guess this will improve the navigation handling a lot. What do you think about it? The code is almost complete and i can provide it soon so you can have a look at it and maybe give it a try ...

report.summary: QR code scanner only excepts one input type
report.label: None yet
report.description: The QR code scanner only works with strings that start with http://coord.info/. It does not work if you scan a QR code that is just a GC code or a TB code. The error presented if I scan just a geocode is "Didn't find any geocode in the scan result." At the very least, the error message should be changed to explain that only scanning http://coord.info/ links will work. I think the best behavior would be to show what was scanned along with the error message. I found a cache today that had a QR code so I scanned it (thinking it would load information about the cache). I just kept getting error messages from c:geo. I finally used my phone's barcode scanner and determined the QR code was just for http://www.geocaching.com I don't want to turn c:geo into a full QR code scanner, but it needs to be clearer what the program is doing and why it might not be working (after all, you usually have no idea what a QR code says when you are scanning it).

report.summary: Faulty DB Clean?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have noticed that added waypoints never seem to go away. Steps: Store a cache Add waypoints to it Drop the cache (it moves to list ID 0) Wait at least 3 days without accessing that cache (so that the it drops from the database) View the cache again The waypoints are still there While this could be considered a feature, it means the waypoints database just gets bigger and bigger (and probably logs, images, trackable, etc too). I think the problem is in clean function in cgData. It is the one the removes the caches after 3 days. It is using RemoveFlag.REMOVE_CACHE which looks to me that it only removes it from the cache cache and not the database. I believe it should be REMOVE_DB. Can anyone second check this?

report.summary: c:geo does not remember last activity on relaunch
report.label: None yet
report.description: I noticed a very annoying bug on my HTC Desire S device. Every time c:geo loses focus, e.g. switched to another app or the phone lock due to manual lock or display timeout, I need to relaunch c:geo. This can be done either by "relaunching" the app or by holding the home button and select c:geo. In the latter c.geo display the last displayed activity. In the former c:geo goes back to its dashboard and I have to reopen the page displayed before. This is very annoying. I expect c:geo to display exactly the activity which has been active before screen lock or app switching. Seems to affect all versions, current markt, rc and nightly.

report.summary: Custom date formats
report.label: None yet
report.description: Currently c:geo defaults to the DD/MM/YYYY date format when displaying cache info and logs. It would be better if it did one of the following (sorted by descending desirability): Use the geocaching.com date format. Use the system date format. Offer a configuration option for date format. C:geo already knows the user's geocaching.com selected date format (otherwise it would not be able to parse log dates), so it would be a trivial change to use the same date format for formatting date output as well.

report.summary: Support NFC tag-based logging
report.label: None yet
report.description: With the availability of NFC chips to new phones as well as the cheap cost of NFC tags, it would be cool to enable cache owners to add an NFC tag which can be scanned to log the find. Functionally this would work very similar to the QR code scanning currently supported - but more passive.

report.summary: Live map initialization
report.label: None yet
report.description: (This is a fork of another issue into a feature request. See: cgeo#1368 for details.) As described in the abovementioned issue, the initialization of the live map behaves differently depending on whether you use Google Maps or OSM. Google Maps defaults to the last known (or viewed) position, whereas OSM defaults to some map-default location, somewhere in the middle of Germany. The map initialization should, in my opinion be (in order of relevance): If "center map on current location" is activated and the location service has a fix, fix the map there (if the preference is on, but there is no fix, proceed - the map will relocate once fix has been obtained) If the location service is off, the "center map on current location" is not selected or the location service has not yet obtained a fix on location, use the following, in the order selected by the user in a user settings: Last known position (persists from last time used - skip if live map has never used before) Home location (user setting - skip if none set) If all of the above fails, let library use its default value.

report.summary: Popup from map slow to update distance to cache
report.label: None yet
report.description: I was out caching this weekend using latest build with GPS turned off (using Network for position). I noticed that when I click a cache on the map, often the popup window would open with distance as "--" (the default) and stay that way for up to 30 seconds. I believe this was introduced in 5a10f40 (observer pattern). I think maybe the problem is that cgeopopup is registering for location updates, but no update is getting fired for some period of time (likely longer since I was using Network and not GPS). Sometimes if I wait till it shows a distance, then open other popups from the map, then they will have a distance right away, but sometimes they still don't. I have reproduced this with GPS turned on as well.

report.summary: EditWaypointActivity - finalDefined not always stored
report.label: None yet
report.description: EditWaypointActivity does a call to cgCache.save to store "finalDefined" attribute. Unfortunately the cache update flag is not set and so not "detailed" caches skip an update (e.g. GC3FR70). Otherwise detailed caches delete/insert original waypoints invalidating origin waypoint static maps filename ... After the refactoring of issue #1557 adding a possibility to store only cache main table data, this should be used in EditWaypointActivity to store the attribute after setting cache update flag to true. So finalDefined can always be stored and original waypoint static maps filenames will never be invalid.

report.summary: Static map previews not created for Details screen when refresh via Popup
report.label: None yet
report.description: Using latest build. Steps: I had imported some caches via GPX I went into the settings and set it to store static maps for caches and waypoints (I normally have it disabled) I connected via wifi (data on the phone was turned off, so wifi was only connection) I viewed one of the lists with OSM offline map (but with no offline map loaded, so it was just blank tiles) I clicked on each cache that was near me so the popup opened I then clicked Refresh in the popup so that static maps would be downloaded Once I was out caching (no more wifi), I scrolled down in the Details window and there were no static maps. I thought maybe I hadn't given it enough time to download before disconnecting the wifi (there is no indication of download start, progressing or completing) But, if I go Menu / Navigate / Static Maps, then the static maps are displayed This happend with all of the caches I refreshed via popup (which I think might be the problem). I think this could be reproduced more simply than all the steps I list above, but I don't have the wifi/data connection to test.

report.summary: Release date for trackable

report.description: Release date for trackables is not displayed (it used to work...)

report.summary: Inconsistent use of SearchResult error code
report.label: None yet
report.description: There are a couple places in the code where the following is used to determine if an error has occurred search.getError() != null. The code assumes that if a non-null value is returned, then an error has occurred. The problem is that the error can be set to StatusCode.NO_ERROR which breaks the logic above. I only see one spot (in GCConnector.java) that actually sets it to NO_ERROR. Here are a couple of ways I see to fix this. Expand all checks to check != null and != NO_ERROR Remove all != null checks and only check != NO_ERROR (requires making sure NO_ERROR is always set) remove NO_ERROR and only use null checks Thoughts? (I realized this as there is a small bug dealing with being offline and viewing caches in history that have been dropped from a list)

However I could use the nearby option for a long time only with the approximate location provided for the 3G connection (inside my house for example without gps) . I’m a premium member and a have the same phone. I’ve been searching for this problem and I didn’t find any solution. Could anyone help me?

report.summary: Make cgeo an organization
report.label: None yet
report.description: We should convert cgeo into an organization, that would let us manage permissions more easily. For example, I'd like an extra mapsforge repository to host our modified version of mapsforge, and we could easily give it the same rights as c-geo-opensource. See https://github.com/blog/674-introducing-organizations for more information about organizations. Assigning @mucek4 :)

Total freaking bummer.

report.summary: make cgeo an available app association
report.label: None yet
report.description: due to the apple patent infringement lawsuit against HTC New devices coming into the USA lost the ability to chose to open cache links in cgeo. now when you click a cache link it will open in browser this appears to be on androids with ics and sense 4.0 they want you to set a default with app associations in settings http://www.imgur.com/IqIEz.jpg http://www.imgur.com/p38os.jpg and unfortunately cgeo isn't a choice http://www.imgur.com/YOhuk.jpg the sense 4.0 automatically sets a default association with the stock browser and if you clear the default it will automatically default to the other available choice and in my case chrome , now I think if cgeo appeared as a browser it would then appear as a choice to open web URLs except the next issue I foresee it all web URLs trying to open with cgeo then getting an error or forceclose is there something that can be done to fix this from searching on the net its an app that strictly runs in the background called htclinkifydispatcher that is blocking the "open link with" popup that would appear prior to apple suing everyone Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: add possibility to change home coordinates
report.label: None yet
report.description: When planning the next vacation cache tour it would be great to customize the home coordinate. So if there is no GPS signal it would not default to the approximate WiFi location, but use the customized home coordinate instead. This also could solve some issues I had with having no location signal at all. (resulted in home coordinates 6000 km from my location [Germany]) It would be even better to have a favorite home coordinate list, but one customizable home coordinate should be pretty sufficient.

report.summary: Feedback Database Queries
report.label: None yet
report.description: In reference to Issue #1827 among others. I'm in favour of dropping the geocode as primary key. It would minimise the effects of broken geocodes. I don't like the way the Database is queried anyway. To populate a list for instance we do these three SELECTS. Retrieving the geocodes using the criteria SELECT COUNT using the criteria SELECT IN using the geocodes There are cases where memory is an issue, but not always. See Issue #1777 where the three SELECTS are called directly one after the other. Any views on this?

report.summary: Feature: Export caches in c:geo format?
report.label: None yet
report.description: In issue #1833 a user wants to export a list of caches to import into another c:geo client. So far I only know that the backup file can be imported into another device. What about a feature to export a list of caches with our own format to transfer almost every data we have? This issue just to ask if we need this. So far we only export in a restricted GC.com GPX format. It fits the requirements on GPS devices but not for import into c:geo.

report.summary: Remove one layer of List menu
report.label: None yet
report.description: From a list of caches, if you choose Menu and then List, you are given two choices: Create new list Change list Clicking Change list gives a listing of all the lists AND an option to create a new list. I propose that when List is clicked, it gives the same menu as when clicking on the name of the list at the top. The only downside I see is that it is an extra tap (and maybe some scrolling) is required to create a new list. But, it is one less click to change lists (for those that don't know about clicking the name)

report.summary: Map (nearby caches) only shows 3 caches
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello, When I search for Nearby caches, I get a list of 20 caches. When I select the map icon, it shows me the map. But only three caches are on them. All 20 caches are within a 2km range so should be on there. It happens for google maps, but also OSM. As it happens the 3 caches are the only caches out of the 20 that used to be stored offline. I dropped them, but they still show up. I remember something about map only showing stored caches, but I couldn't find any info on that. Also read the faq, but I still think the expected the behaviour is to have all 20 caches shown? Is this correct, or am I missing something? Thanks and keep up the good work! I have a free GC account, and login is ok. Using newest 28/6 version.

report.summary: Request: Enable import from bcaching.com
report.label: None yet
report.description: http://bcaching.com is greate website which can receive gpxs directly from GC.com via email. It imports them into your personal list of geocaches. You can download them into the android app "GeoBeagle". However GeoBeagle is much less sophisticated compared to c:geo. So it would be cool to have c:geo connect to bcaching.com also to import those caches into your Offline Caches list. Also an easy way to keep the caches up to date, saving on requests to GC.com. EDIT: Here's info on the bcaching.com API.

report.summary: Formula solver for multi
report.label: None yet
report.description: Would it possible to implement a such feature based on GCBuddy app : http://www.btstsoft.nl/apps/gcbuddy/ ? I already had this idea a few months ago and did something on javascript. It works perfectly for me but it is not usable on a mobile device :( Here are the required steps (from my own point of view) : add 1 field "formula" in waypoint add a page for each cache to enter values (A,B,C) and a "compute" coordinates button. User enter values as soon as he gets a new value during the hike. Click "generates" button calculates new coord values for child waypoints with formula (if all required values are present). Technically, javax.script.ScriptEngineManager (or JEXL) could manage eval job. From my experience, user should input himself the formula because extract formula from text's cache is really hard. Used format is not always the same. (x or * for multiplication, ( or [ for input...)

report.summary: Crash when switching from compass to map
report.label: None yet
report.description: When I use the live map and click on a cache, you get the short overview from the cache. There you can directly use the navigation (I use the internal compass). When I click on the navigation, I get the compass view. Over the menu in the compass view you can switch from the compass view to the map view. If I use this order c:geo is crashing. Can somebody reproduce this issue? I have this issue only with the OSM. Live map select a cache direct navigation (not details and use the internal compass) switching from compass to map crash I use the HTC Desire HD with Android 2.3.5 regards PS: How can I set the bug label?

report.summary: Replace map icon to coordinates found in personal cache note
report.label: None yet
report.description: At the moment c:geo already recognizes a coordinate in the personal cache note and treats it as a waypoint which is great. It would be nice though to have the map icon re-positioned to this location. (and change to the icon with a red flag overlay for example to indicate a re-positioned icon like it is done already in the listing of nearby caches which have a "final location" waypoint) The reasoning: I often write the final location of mysteries and multies in the personal field note. Then on the map you can easily see the "actual" cache location while planning your route on the road. also, when placing a cache it can help with checking the proximity of the actual cache locations.

report.summary: Disabled caches not shown with line initially
report.label: None yet
report.description: I have just installed the latest version on my Galaxy Nexus running 4.2.1 and when viewing my stored caches, the closest ones (which are all disabled) did not appear so (no line through them). If I went to read the content, the line does appear through the name in the description but not the title. When I then go back to the list, the line appears... I then tried this with the next three and all I have to do is look at the description and then go back and it then gets the line. It appears not to be picking up the flag that says it is disabled on the first reading. Still a great app. Thanks Steve

report.summary: Filter specific lists on live map
report.label: None yet
report.description: Some relevance to other discussions of filtering, but this goes further.. In the live map, I have lots (like 5000+) caches displayed from multiple lists - holiday locations, local caches, todo caches, specific cache series, etc etc etc.. The live map just displays them ALL. It would be really handy to be able to select/deselect lists for display in the live map. e.g. "Show me the Brocklesby Hunt series list" "Show me my local caches list" "Show me just my To-Do favourites list" "Show me my lists for missing months for 2001 and 2002 for the Jasmer challenge" From the live map, the user would hit the 'more' option, and an option to 'select lists'. A list of the user's available lists would be presented, with a checkbox against each. A global select all / select none checkbox would be available too. The user can select just those particular lists they are interested in viewing, and hit 'back'. Those caches not in the user's selected lists would be excluded from the map.

report.summary: Record and display new cache placements
report.label: None yet
report.description: c:geo is great for finding caches. But.. c:geo is not so great for placing new caches. We can check for proximity - Good, mostly. We can find out our current coordinates - Yes, but not so good. We can record and display our new placement - It's possible, but not good at all. Placing caches is something I find difficult in c:geo, and I revert to other apps and pencil/paper. Is this other side of caching something c:geo is aimed at? Should it be? It would be a lot of work to add features aimed at geocache placers, but it would give users more tie-in into this app by giving them less need to go elsewhere. Checking for proximity is catered for very well. This is something c:geo does nicely with the circles on the live map. Recording / averaging our current coordinate? That's a bit trickier. The best way I can find to get our current coordinate is to open up another cache somewhere else and try to add an extra waypoint to it. From there, I can see my current coordinate and ... jot it down on a piece of paper. OK, so I can add a waypoint onto that other cache to temporarily record my placement on the device, but that's such a faff. I have to remember roughly where it is to find it again, and which cache I stored it under (which might be miles away if I'm placing a cache in a virgin area), and then I have the maintenance fuss of deleting that waypoint and moving it somewhere more permanent - back to my pencil and sheet of paper. What would be a better way? A 'My Placements' area in c:geo dedicated to storing waypoints of potential hides. This area would effectively be a stored list of caches, but these would be a different class. These 'My Placements' caches would have no GC code, would have just a UID generated by the device, would have in their simplest form just an editable title and editable notes, and would appear on the live map, perhaps with a different icon to indicate they are one of your placements rather than a real cache. For placement of multi or puzzle caches, a single 'My Placements' cache could contain multiple waypoints. The live map would show proximity circles, just as with any other type of cache. Access to view the list of 'My Placements' could be through the 'stored' section, or through the main menu, but creation of a new 'My Placement' cache would be through the 'more' section of the live map. The user would select to create a new placement, and would be given their current coordinate and allowed to enter title and notes and perhaps select some attributes. The system would allow for coordinate averaging, storing multiple samples for a point over time.

report.summary: Global cache type filter not working on live map for me
report.label: None yet
report.description: (Market version from 12/12/12) I had the global cache type filter set to show only "Event Cache". I opened the live map, with the 'live' mode enabled. Lots of caches appeared with "??" markers, including many I know are traditionals. On opening one of them, the marker changed to the "traditional" marker with the smiley face and the floppy disk icon - it's one of the caches which is already in my "stored" list and already stored as "found". As I understand it, the request to gc.com should have been asking for only event caches? More than just event caches were downloaded.

report.description: A great thing with c:geo has always been the ability to test drive unpublished own caches. Now when I try to search for an unpublished cache's gc-code I get the message "c:geo failed to load the cache details. The cache is unpublished" Why is this restriction added?

report.summary: Ability to toggle size of map marker
report.label: None yet
report.description: Sometimes when using the satellite view the cache marker is in the way and covers essential areas. Especially when zoomed in to the max. It would be great if you could be able to toggle the cache marker so it just becomes a tiny dot/crosshair.

report.summary: filter
report.label: None yet
report.description: is that possible to do a filter caches by a bookmark , i think it will be interesting to implement on c:geo

report.summary: StaticMapsActivity - Exception on menu / refresh action
report.label: None yet
report.description: On my PR #2550 as a fix for #2507 I found that refreshing on StaticMapsActivity causes cgeo to stop due to a network access on main thread. This is not relating to my changes in #2550 but still exists for a longer time now showing up.

report.summary: send 2 c:geo caches aren't appearing on device..
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've been using both c:geo and my browser is registered for send 2 c:geo and device has been recognized with pin number. Having clicked the send to device button on my browser and the Import from the Web button on my device, the devices c:geo home screen now shows 6 stored. But when clicking on the stored button on the device, nothing appears. Clicking between 'All caches' and 'Stored' (which shows a [6]) still doesn't resolve the problem. Whats going wrong?

report.summary: Cache count in nearby search is wrong
report.label: None yet
report.description: Found with NB 2013.03.14: Perform nearby search 20 results are returned (as usual) The headline shows Nearby[45] for me After loading the next 20 results it shows [65] So it seems it is counting wrong by +25 (at least in my case)

report.summary: no Configmenu
report.label: None yet
report.description: in the nightly build ion my TAB is no configmenu. Jelly Bean on Samsung Note 10.

report.summary: Cached images handling
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi all, today I had some problems with integrity of my SD card. It is not connected to c:geo, but it pointed me to this ... there is .cgeo directory (used as cache, storage of cgeo sqlite backup and ...) ... there were about 3000 directories, but I have only 900 caches stored. How this is maintained ? I feel that it is "write-only", saved when needed, but never deleted.

report.summary: Find a way to reenable StaticMapsProviderTest
report.label: None yet
report.description: The StaticMapsProviderTest.java test has been disabled in 512ae6d. It was failing very often and prevented other failures (or successes) from showing up in the test results. The test should be re-enabled but should attempt to download static maps for real.

report.summary: out of memory error
report.label: None yet
report.description: When refreshing all of my 1000 stored caches I regularly get 1 or 2 out of memory errors. (in version [2013.04.03], but also in previous versions) However its not about a single cache, because I always manage to refresh all of them. (after several retries) Could be some kind of memory leak. More informations: Android: 2.2.1 Phone: Samsung Galaxy 9000 Exception: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError Location: CharArrayBuffer.expand (CharArrayBuffer.java:63) CharArrayBuffer.append (CharArrayBuffer.java:93) ActivityCompatHoneycomb.toString(RequiredFields.java:225) getResponseDataNoError (Network.java:417) ... I just submitted an bug report via my phone with the text: "out of memory error 2013-04-07 SP".

report.summary: Not possible to project waypoint, when distance units are localised
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I had discovered one funny bug caused by localisation of distance unit names. When it is localised, it is not possible to project waypoints (distance). So .. should i remove that localised names ... or modify code, that it will be controlled by selector position, not by strings ?

report.summary: List sorting does not respect locale
report.label: None yet
report.description: In my locale (Czech), accented characters (ěščřž...) should be sorted after their unaccented version. But in list of lists, they aren't. In the screenshot, Šatov should be between Praha and Tatry.

report.summary: Don't show short description, if same as long description
report.label: None yet
report.description: If the short description is the same as the start of the long description, then it should not be displayed. Example: OC49C6.

report.summary: Personal note doesn't work
report.label: None yet
report.description: Seit kurzem kann man "Persönliche Notiz" unter einer Cache-Beschreibung zwar noch antippen und da auch was schreiben, doch es gibt keine Möglichkeit mehr zum speichern, weder über Enter noch über ein "OK"-Button

report.summary: Personal note deleted after cache refresh
report.label: None yet
report.description: Steps to reproduce: (1. Premium user)? 2. Add personal note in c:geo 3. Do not add personal note on gc.com, leave it empty 4. Refresh cache Personal log is deleted.

report.summary: Menu Button is missing on HTC One SV
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi guys! After the update to Android 4.1.2 of the HTC One SV the menu button is missing. I am not able to change my settings anymore. See Screenshot:

report.summary: exception in ListAdapter of AnyDestinationActivity
report.label: None yet
report.description: 05-10 08:52:17.558: E/AndroidRuntime(7578): FATAL EXCEPTION: main 05-10 08:52:17.558: E/AndroidRuntime(7578): java.lang.IllegalStateException: The content of the adapter has changed but ListView did not receive a notification. Make sure the content of your adapter is not modified from a background thread, but only from the UI thread. [in ListView(2131427555, class android.widget.ListView) with Adapter(class android.widget.HeaderViewListAdapter)] 05-10 08:52:17.558: E/AndroidRuntime(7578): at android.widget.ListView.layoutChildren(ListView.java:1538)

report.summary: Owned and discovered caches not filtered out
report.label: None yet
report.description: Bonjour, j'utilise un Garmin A50 sous Android : 2 questions : 1- Quand j'ouvre la carte CGEO mes caches placées et celles que j'ai découvertes apparaissent bien que dans les paramètres je demande qu'elles soient cachées. Je ne suis pas Premium. Est-ce la raison ??? 2- Quand je trouve des caches je l'enregistre dans le carnet off-line. Quand je rentre et passe en Wi-Fi ou en 3G y-a-t-il une possibilité pour les envoyer en un seul bloc, sans devoir les ouvrir une par une ? D'avance merci. Vincent Google translation: Hello, I use a Garmin A50 Android 2 questions: 1 - When I open my map CGEO caches placed and those that I discovered that appear in the settings I ask that they be hidden. I'm not Premium. Is that the reason?? 2 - When I find caches I record in the book offline. When I come home and go into Wi-Fi or 3G is there a possibility to send in one piece without having to open them one by one? In advance thank you. Vincent

report.summary: Errors in coloring cache description
report.label: None yet
report.description: There are some problems when checking/adjusting colors in the cache description. There is no handling of white fonts when using light skin. This gives this problem: The checks are for color=. This causes incorrect matches on bgcolor=. This is what causes this cache to get a gray background even though it doesn't have black text. To solve part 2, I first thought to change it to color= with a leading space, but this doesn't have to be true, so I am thinking about maybe stripping all bgcolor from the text before checking for color but I don't want to make a second copy of the entire text in memory again. Any feedback?

It is, of course, mostly an esthetical issue but it's kinda hard to see what type of cache it is when the floppyicon blocks out more than half the circle. :) Hopefully it's an easy fix (or maybe it's just something wrong with my phone, anyone else got this?) Tobias Andersson I suspect it got something to do with the higher resolution on the S4 but what do I know. Tobias Andersson Looked into it and it goes for all of the "add-on"-icons. The floppy, the smiley etc.

report.summary: OC search no longer working without authorization
report.label: None yet
report.description: The new connector always tries to do OAuth level 3 authentication, even for methods where this is not needed. That leads to the situation that one can no longer search for OC1234 from the quick search or search. We should only use the OAuth authentication, if the method really requires it, otherwise we enforce the user to authentication.

report.summary: Distance to cache for BM based on search location not user location
report.label: None yet
report.description: This is entered for tracking purposes. If a BM does a Nearby search, then the distance is approximated as we don't have the cache coords. If a BM does a search by location, then the distance shown is in reference to where the search was done, not the user. Example: Go into Search Enter somewhere into the Address box and Search (I entered Hamburg) In the resulting list, the caches show as several hundred feet away instead of several thousand miles I'd suggest this limitation entered into the FAQ.

Do you have an idea how to keep the solved mysteries in the related list also?

report.summary: Extract coordinates when entering 'personal note' manually in C:geo
report.label: None yet
report.description: This sounds like a strange request because why not add a waypoint? Well the reason is as follows. On multiple locations I have received coordinates in email, text, or even from OCRing a picture. I copy and paste the text into the 'personal note' of the cache. But now it does not become a waypoint. If the text was in the 'personal note' before (on the website) and it would load, it would have become a waypoint. So the easy request. Can we extract coordinates when entering the personal note in C:geo. this allow me to copy and paste a large number of coordinates at once using copy/paste and not have to make a lot of individual waypoints.

After saving, on both my SGN (Android 4.2.2) and the 2.2 device, the cache on the map was not decorated with the floppy. Only after clicking on the cache icon and then hitting back,

report.summary: add tags like climbing, swimming, diving to caches and show additional small icons in live map
report.label: None yet
report.description: I searched for a similar request, but I couldn't find one. I would like to be able to see if a cache would need me to bring some tools (to climb, to dive, to swim, ...) when I look at the live map. Unfortunately the attributes of caches could not be used for this as not all caches are using attributes in the same way. (a climbing cache could miss the "climbing required" attribute although the description tells me to climb) Currently the best way to solve the problem is using several lists for each kind of tag I am using and then showing only this list in the live map. There are several downsides of this. (a cache can only have one tag at a time; caches from the normal live map can't be distinguished) Short term improvements: *A list could have a symbol. Each cache in the list would be displayed along with the symbol. *One could manually add tags to caches. An according symbol would make the tag visible in the live map. Long term improvements: *One could reuse the mechanism for a global filter system (issue #995) to use a filter result as dynamic tag. (a search could be combined like: attribute = "climbing required" OR owner = "climbing only" OR GC-Code = GC1234, GC5678) *Cache appearance (color, shape, symbol) could be determined by filters too. (Source = OC -> shape quadratic; Terrain = T5 -> color red) These are only my ideas of the topic. I would love to hear what you think of it.

report.summary: Navigation - no option to choose navigation menu on waypoints other than default setting
report.label: None yet
report.description: I am using nightly build 2013.06.14-NB-76f59b8 There has been a change in the waypoints are handled, and I vote to return it to the previous method. The change: long press on a waypoint takes a user straight to the edit screen. The problem: there is no means to navigate to the waypoint other than by the default means - the small compass icon on the waypoint view. In previous versions, a long press on the waypoint would provide the navigation menu, and options such as navigate(driving) would be availble. I cannot find a means to achieve this any more. Example: I have a puzzle cache with modified co-ordinates. When stored in c:geo, the original co-ordinates are also stored, and these can often be the parking place for access to the cache which I use to access my driving navigation application. It maybe related to this, but when a waypoint is selected on the map view, a menu -> navigate also takes the user directly to the default navigation took (Radar in my case). Previously I was presented with the navigate selection menu. Please can I have it back :)

report.summary: App keeps using gps/draining battery even after closing
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hello! My problem is, as stated in the title, that c:geo seems to use my phones gps even when it's closed. By default my gps tracking is switched off and I turn it on manually when I go GC hunting. When I've found what I've been looking for (using this great app), I turn off the gps tracking and close c:geo. However I've noticed that even after I've closed the app and turned gps tracking off it still seems to use the gps somehow. When I check the use details of c:geo under battery usage it shows that it still uses gps and drains battery accordingly. The gps usage time (and battery drain) won't stop until I've done a full phone restart, even force closing the app won't help, only restart. Anyone else having this issue (or is it an issue at all or am I doing something wrong)? I tried to search for similar topics, but couldn't find any. I'm new to c:geo, but I've found it to be a great app already, just hate to restart my phone after using c:geo just to conserve my battery. Any help would be greatly appreciated! I'm using c:geo (ver. 2013.06.05) on my galaxy nexus (android 4.2.2). Sorry if I'm in the wrong place with this, so feel free to redirect/delete/whatnot if so ;) Thanks, Runkha

report.summary: Clicking on a ?? cache in Live Map destroys previously-downloaded Status data, does not download again
report.label: None yet
report.description: I discovered this while working on #2234. Scroll to an area where you found many caches on the live map, and the outer ones will load as ?? caches because the details aren't important. If you click one, the pop-up loads some more details about it, but it loses track of the "Found" status on the cache. Now, if you close the pop-up, the smiley face indicating that the cache was found is missing. This also affects my fix for #2234; if you select a ?? cache which was found, and then click "Hide own/found caches", that cache will not disappear with all the other ones. Clicking "More Details" in the pop-up (causing it to load that information again) will fix the problem. The cache status needs to be downloaded when clicking the pop-up, or the "Found" status needs to be kept somewhere. I'll try to fix this.

report.summary: Another direction mode for the talking compass
report.label: None yet
report.description: The talking compass function tells the direction to the cache in relation to the compass direction. You therefore have to point your smartphone to a specific direction such that the compass direction is a meaningful value, right? The direction output "3 o'clock" only makes sense if I hold the smartphone horizontally and with the upper side away from me. I would like to use the talking compass while keeping the smartphone in my pocket. This way I could approximate the cache without being noticed that I am a geocacher. I therefore suggest another direction mode which tells the bearing. Either in cardinal directions (north, north-east, east, ...) or with the pure value in degrees. This assumes that you have a slight notion on where 'north' is.

report.summary: Easier way to select which caches are shown on the (live) map
report.label: None yet
report.description: I would like to have a easy way to control which caches are displayed on the (live) map. Now we have to go to the home screen -> settings and loose the current viewed positions on the map. Implementing Issue #3078 "Live map should start at last position if not fixed to current position" would eliminate that effect but it is still a long way to the related settings. SIMPLE SOLUTION Add a "Settings" button to the menu of the map. That way we can reach the settings "Exclude own and found caches" and "Exclude disabled caches" more easier. EXTENDED SOLUTION Add a submenu "View" like "Map View" to The menu. It contains a list of check boxes which enables when marked the display of the related Caches. Some ideas for Options: Own and found Disabled Whit stored Log (Caches I couldn't find) All other (hide all so we can see the map in crowded areas) From which "Stored" lists (submenu, giving the option to select any combinations of lists - I don't want to see caches on my 'Riddels to solve online' list out in the field.) Type (maybe submenu) Difficulty (maybe submenu whit selection of which counts of stars) Alternative this menu could be called "Filter" and removers the selected kinds of cached from the map.

CacheLab will be published under a closed source commercial licence. report.summary: Coordinates in "Radar" off by .001 in lon or lat direction for many caches
report.label: None yet
report.description: I use „Radar“ (GPS Status 4.3.78) when approaching a cache. I notice the coordinates sent to that app are off by .001 in lon or lat direction for many caches. Examples: GC423BT, listed at N50° 47,654 and E 006° 04,212. When switching to Radar, target coordinates are N50° 47.654 (OK), but E 006° 04.211! Same for GC34TXF (N 50° 48,247 E 006° 04,622) targeted in Radar as N 50° 48.246, E 006° 4.622. I only noticed it in lon or lat component, never in both at the same time. Some caches are OK, like GC4DCZH. Build-in "Kompass" is OK, so i guess it has to do with sending the coordinates to GPS Status app, While the difference is small, in urban settings it can be crucial, and i start to reason about why i did not find so many caches during the last weeks. I did not notice that difference…
