report.summary: Update shown caches
report.label: None yet
report.description: If you look at the map and see a couple of unsaved caches, you can choose to save them for offline, but it would be great to have the option to Update shown caches on the map (to se if some of them are archived and so on without to have to update them one by one)

report.summary: Cache rating, popularity, TB info not exported to GPX file
report.label: None yet
report.description: Helo, I have exported a set of caches to the GPX file, transported the file to another device and imported it to the c:geo again on the second device. But the caches does not contain the rating, popularity, inventory (TB) info etc. on the second device.

report.summary: GPX export failed
report.label: None yet
report.description: When exporting cache GC32996 or GC2N3YV to the GPX, c:geo display message "export failed". Actualy there is second issue with this. When exporting a lot of caches and c:geo display short message "export failed" somewhere in the middle. So it is not easy to find which cache caused the failure. It would be usefull to display also code or name of the cache in the message.

report.summary: Importing .loc file has wrong progress dialog
report.label: None yet
report.description: I discovered that when I import .loc file I see whole time progress dialog for reading of file (process of importing caches is working, but progress is still showing 100% of reading a file, nothing about downloading caches from websites). http://i.imgur.com/Dbru1Bc.png This problem is present on android 4.0, ASUS FonePad. I don't know if elsewhere. If you can try I would like to know if I'm alone facing this issue or not.

report.summary: Caches on map
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi i have two problems (sorry for my english). First: On active map instead of type of cache is displayed two question marks (?? - unknown type) until i open cache details. Saved caches are displayed corectly Second: Visited caches are displayed like unvisited even if filter is active. On the begining of using this app everything was OK it started about week ago.

report.summary: Support Trackables With the QR Scanner Included in c:geo
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hopefully I am clear enough with this request. There are trackable tags out there that have a QR printed on them. Some examples: http://shop.geocaching.com/default/trackable-items/travel-bugs/new-geocaching-qr-travel-bugr-black.html http://shop.geocaching.com/default/trackable-items/qr-tech-tags/qr-tech-tag.html The QR contains the url of the trackable page including the tracking code. Currently you can already scan these with any barcode scanning app and be taken to the trackable page within c:geo. What I am requesting though is to be able to scan these with the "Geocode" scanner that is already included within c:geo and be taken to the trackable page without ever having to leave the app. Currently the geocode scanner only supports cache pages using the userscript here: http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/95134 I will also contact the author of the userscript to see if he can add QR to trackable pages also.

report.summary: Flip between the preferred and the secondary navigation by a single click
report.label: None yet
report.description: When approaching a cache you usually use the map at first and then filp over to compass or radar when you are close to GZ. However you might frequently flip between them at GZ to account for the local topology (tracks, water, street sides, etc.). This should be achievable for the c:geo internally provided navigations such as map and compass (e.g. by an explicit separate button at the top or by an implict click area as I proposed it in PR #3427) but for externally provided navigations I have no approach in mind.

report.summary: Flip between the preferred and the secondary navigation by a single click
report.label: None yet
report.description: When approaching a cache you usually use the map at first and then filp over to compass or radar when you are close to GZ. However you might frequently flip between them at GZ to account for the local topology (tracks, water, street sides, etc.). The implementation should be achievable for the c:geo internally provided navigations such as map and compass (e.g. by an explicit separate button at the top or by an implict click area as I proposed it in PR #3427) but for externally provided navigations I have no approach in mind.

report.summary: CGEO blackberry z30
report.label: None yet
report.description: When I clicked on "nearby" to see nearby caches, there is no way to filter only caches I didn't find. I see that I can filter to have pretty much everything else. I can use the map and I can see the caches with and without smiles, and I can pick from there, but it would be nice to have the the list filtered to "didn't find" only.

report.summary: Translation typo and feature request
report.label: None yet
report.description: In slovak translation, there´s an attribute: "dogs allowed". In slovak language it is translated as "psi povolené" and that should be "psy povolené". Also I would like to mark my own caches as found so I can easily sort them on my phone, because I don´t normally find my own caches. It could be as a setting. Thanks, c:geo is a great app!

report.summary: 'Visited' not saved for own waypoints

report.description: ob my nexus7 at android4.4 c:geo doesn't Run it Starts and at "Live-Karte" it crashed down :-(

report.summary: Remove 'found' option
report.label: None yet
report.description: There is an option to remove past events but to remove all found caches an user has to sort them to have found on the top, tick all found and remove chosen, so three steps. An option to remove all found would do that in one step. The most important is that this option should remove only found and logged online (green color), not found and logged offline (orange color).

report.summary: Add option for Pebble watch in Navigate menu
report.label: None yet

report.summary: Error in log when clearing user name in settings
report.label: None yet
report.description: Just as a reminder for myself: If the username is cleared in the input dialog of the settings, then an error is written to the log (noticed this yesterday). Will update with more details later.

report.summary: Quick update of cache state via list of found caches
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, sometimes I'm facing problem, that I log via field notes from computer and in that case I have caches not found in c:geo to get it to actual state it is needed to update caches, but it take some time and wastes gc.com servers. What about function which can update just Found/DNF/Attended ... from this url: http://www.geocaching.com/my/logs.aspx?s=1 ? It can download just one page for this purpose, which is much more acceptable than refreshing all caches. The only problem is that on that page we have name of cache and GUID, but not GC code.

report.summary: Database get moved to wrong storage
report.label: None yet
report.description: In settings > system it's possible to move the database to the sd-card. But that don't work right on my Sony Xperia V. When I use that function the data gets moved from phone-storage to internal-storage instead of external sd-card. It would be very helpful if it would be possible to choose the right storage.

report.summary: gc language setting always turns to English on c:geo access
report.label: None yet
report.description: This was already reported by Ticketautomat and issue is closed - but not solved. I am annoyed about the language setting of my account in gc.com is so often switched to English. I wrote to GC about it. Their answer was a question: Do I use some other application that uses the gc account? Of course I do - c:geo. Now I made some tests: C:geo is off. Then several log-ins and log-outs on gc homepage. Language stayed always German (fine). One log-in with c:geo, then next log-in on gc homepage shows language setting changed to English (bad). This is reproducable. I don't even have to log-out and re-log-in on the web site to see this language change. It is sufficient to start c:geo and then press F5 (refresh) in my PC web browser to see the language change to English. Either the app does the language switch or the gc api does it implicitly in the backend when it is used by c:geo. Please help.

report.summary: change metric to imperial units
report.label: None yet
report.description: I found the faq to make the change. However I can not find a main menu / settings or appearance. Nor has it changed automatically. It was fine on my old Motorola phone, but now I have a Samsung Galaxy S 5. How can I change to imperial units ? c:geo uses metric units by default but should be able to detect if you are using a local setting which defaults to imperial units and will adapt to it automatically. A manual change can be done in c:geo settings (main screen, Press menu, Select settings, Select Appearance) and select "Use Imperial units".

report.summary: blocking network in HtmlImage.getDrawable
report.label: None yet
report.description: I was just trying to fix #4036 by just making the URL part of the regex more tolerant. That worked fine, but afterwards by emulator was hanging for eternity when trying to download the avatar image. I guess this is because of the toBlocking() in HtmlImage.getDrawable(). Generally speaking, right now the image CDN of GC.com is somewhat broken as it seems (it creates direct links instead of using the CDN, and the https links deliver http traffic). Nevertheless we should not have such blocking calls with a time limit.

report.summary: "Partner mode" show caches a member of a group didn't found
report.label: None yet

The Problem ist, you often go caching with a group of people which do not have found the same caches, but only one or two are using there devices, to save battery. Sometimes you walk past a cache some members would like to log, but nobody knows there is a cache they need. Maybe you can "connect" accounts by scanning a QR-Code from another device and c:geo only hides the finds of all members currently connected. It would be an awesome feature of an already great app!

report.summary: Cache coordinates of WherIGo should be changeable too
report.label: None yet
report.description: For mystery and multi caches it is possible to change the cache coordinates. E.g. after I've solved a mystery, I set the coordinates of the cache to the coordinates of the final. For WherIGo caches it is not possible as well. Usually I will start at the given coordinates. But especially in the case of Play-Anywhere-WherIGos, I'm getting the coordinates of a final box during the game. Now I would be happy if I can set the coordinates of the cache. I'll be happy if you implement this change. btw: Thanks a lot for your work and keep on hacking

report.summary: Caching / Offline map tiles for Google Maps
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, If I am not mistaken, currently the Google Maps integration in c:geo does not cache map tiles? I know I can use OSM maps to have offline maps, but these have some points that could be considered sub-optimal: You have to either store complete countries in your phone, or create your own maps for the areas you need. For example the map for Germany is 1.3GB. In some countries Google Maps is just a lot better compared to OSM. Would you consider implementing support for the caching of Google Maps tiles? By caching I mean caching them for a couple of day or so. I think the Google Maps API v2 (#2222) supports storing tiles offline and allows to keep tiles stored for up to 30 days? In a perfect world, we would be using the offline storage of the official Android Google Maps app. This app can store maps offline in a convenient way: all zoom levels are stored. So when preparing for a trip, or for areas you frequently visit, you keep the maps stored offline in Google Maps. If c:geo could use this, it would be very helpful. I've tried to google whether this is possible, but couldn't really find any info on it. I would be willing to help on the implementation, but first we need to agree on whether it's a desired feature, etc. Opper

report.description: Android 4.4.4 c:geo 2014.12.22 Geocache: http://coord.info/GC3A2GV On android device: When visualising a cache details, if you slide screens right when you get to images screen: only 2 images visible. In browser you can see: View the Image Gallery of 17 images.

report.summary: Navigate to Geocache using Waze
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm a frequent Waze user and would like to see the option to use the Waze app to navigate to a Geocache instead. Using waze we could easily avoid traffic jams etc when driving to a location.

report.summary: Compass not working
report.label: None yet
report.description: I love c:geo - have been using it ever since I got a smartphone, but I've recently encountered a rather annoying issue. The compass no longer works. The distance to the cache updates fine, but the compass does not function properly. It seems to only want to bounce between 2 different headings (between 0-30 degrees and between 180-210 degrees). This only became an issue within the past few weeks; I'm not sure if it was after an update or not. I check the compass in other apps, and it works fine elsewhere. I've also tried it both using GPS and compass and GPS only, and neither one works. Is there something I can do to fix this issue? I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app with the same issue still present. I use a Samsung Galaxy S3 (SPH-L710) running Android version 4.4.2

report.summary: Shortcut menu to fast log offline disappeared ?
report.label: None yet
report.description: Last version saw a new "really useful" feature : a menu to fast mark as found without enter into the log. But now, feature has gone. What is the status of this feature ? I really loved this one.

report.summary: Update all caches from the list of all stored caches
report.label: None yet
report.description: The stored caches can be updated one-by-one or list-by-list, but not globally. It would be nice to add this action.

report.summary: SD Card Problem on my Samsung Galaxy 4 Mini
report.label: None yet
report.description: The SD card is not shown in the file selection of C:geo. So I can not, for example, select the location for the Off-line map. I can only access the internal SD memory. I using a Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini. Thanks for your help.

report.summary: Offline map not rendered properly
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I'm using c:geo, and I'm happy with it. Thanks for your work! However, I found some bugs. Here is the first. The offline map is not rendered properly. Depending on the zoom level, some portions are not displayed. I'm using offline map downloaded from mapsforge website, suggested in c:geo's FAQ. I don't know if the problem is with the c:geo or with the map. It's up to you to check it :} This bug is also present in one of my friends phone. You can find attached a screenshot how it looks. Best regards, kukukk

report.summary: Spoiler photo from hint not downloaded for offline use
report.label: None yet
report.description: Sorry, It seems that it was already reported and it's fixed: #4633 Hi, When I store the caches for offline use, images from hint are not downloaded. Even if I refresh all stored caches, the images is still missing. If I refresh the cache itself, the image appears. But it is stored only temporarily. If I leave cache details, go back to the map and select the cache again and lick on "More details" the image is missing. I hope you can fix it as soon as possible, because I had some bad lucks with it, being in a zone where there was no mobile internet and the only hint was that photo. Best regards, kukukk

report.summary: more strict javadoc checks
report.label: None yet
report.description: Since empty tags have been cleaned in fa6741e, the Eclipse settings should be changed to warn about empty tags.

report.summary: Hide the show as list menu in map for single cache
report.label: None yet
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Actionbar content changed
report.label: None yet
report.description: While with yesterdays version (2015.02.14-NB) the actionbar on the waypoint tab of a cache contained a map icon, it now (2015.02.15-NB1) has the same structure as on the cache detail tab. I would strongly suggest to have the map icon located at first position as implemented before.

report.summary: Crash on a self generated map
report.label: None yet
report.description: I'm currently working on a project to create maps from an amalgamation of data (OSM, OS, shapefiles). These are processed to generate a single OSM file which I am then processing with Osmosis and mapsforge mapfile-writer to generate .map file to be viewed on various Android apps. These maps almost always work on all the maps and apps I've tested (Atlas application on Windows and Locus/Orux/cgeo on Android). I have one map which causes a crash when I try to load it in cgeo on both my tablet and my phone. Other than looking at the log file and asking here is there any easy way to find what might be causing the problem? I've tested maybe 5 other maps (almost all covering larger areas and one much larger one which includes the area causing the fault) and they all work fine. I've uploaded 2 maps to Dropbox (https://www.dropbox.com/sh/chaxjx4oxtjs9ih/AACf9g0wNcRgCOB5n4IaMWDOa?dl=0) OS_NU_android crashes and OS_TEST_android (which is a subset of it) doesn't. I'm not used to checking log files on Android but I've managed to recover: build.board: baylake build.bootloader: unknown build.brand: asus build.cpu_abi: x86 build.cpu_abi2: armeabi-v7a build.device: report.summary: Spoiler of GC3CJ0K cache is not displayed
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi c:geo team, sometimes, spoilers or log photos of geocaches are not displayed in c:geo, when storing cache for offline use (or even online). Example : spoiler of http://coord.info/GC3CJ0K cgeo version 2015.01.20, android version 4.4.2 or android version 4.1.2 Other example with missing some log images : GC1PCV7 If you could something... thanks :)

report.summary: Create release from release branch
report.label: None yet
report.description: Due to #4693 and #4691 we should create a new release from the release branch, rather quickly. (And afterwards we should schedule a release from master for beginning of March).

report.summary: [Feature request] Add view of recently opened caches
report.label: None yet
report.description: I know that one can save caches for offline use and that there's a list of what I logged, but there should be a list of recently opened caches, just like it is on geocache.com profile main page. It would be very helpful for a typical usage scenario where I visit several caches but don't want to fiddle around with the smartphone for writing the log text, but log at home in peace and comfortably. And for that I'd need a view of the visited caches in the order of opening. I assume it should be quite easy to implement, there would be no need to synchronize with the geocache.com list, but only store locally in c:geo the last x caches which were opened in detail.

report.summary: Hiding out found/own cache no longer reliably working
report.label: None yet
report.description: 2015.03.07-NB On maps other than the live map (map for a list, single cache map with activated live) I had problems to day to hide found/owned caches if I toggle that setting directly from the map. Need to look deeper into this to provide more details. On the live map it seemed to be OK.

report.summary: Can't see offline logs / offline logs only on the map visible
report.label: None yet
report.description: If I make offline logs during a geocacheing session, I can't see them in c:geo. Only on the map, when i scroll to the position of the cache, the cache with the red smiley is shown. I think it would be usefull, if a cache is logged offline, that the cache will automatically saved on the default list or on a list like 'offline logs'.

report.summary: NextPageGeocacheListLoader doesn't use parallelCombineActive
report.label: None yet
report.description: The actual implementation of the NextPageGeocacheListLoader doesn't use parallelCombineActive. In case of multiple connectors supporting loading next page calls will be parallelized. (However, as of today we only have GC connetor supporting this). This will be necessary for #4802. The "load more cache" function should call parallelCombineActive, as retrieving Generic Trackable will be hooked there.

report.summary: Some unit test on OkapiClient are missing

report.description: At least some tests about Trackables in caches should be added. Take care of: cgeo/main/src/cgeo/geocaching/connector/oc/OkapiClient.java Line 438 in f7e3196 cache.mergeInventory(parseTrackables((ArrayNode) response.path(CACHE_TRACKABLES)));

report.summary: c:geo revert geocaching.com website language settings back to English
report.label: None yet
report.description: Hi, I left the following message to the geocaching.com site: "How can I store my user interface language more permanently. Apparently, this option uses cookies to store language? I don't want to store cookies permanently, because I also use public computers. If I close browser and logged in again, the user interface language setting is returned back to original." ..and geocaching.com answer: "Hello, Thank you for contacting Geocaching HQ. Do you use the Android app c:geo? There is a bug currently in the app that is reverting your language settings back to English on our website. Since this is third party website, we have no control over fixing it. You will have to reach out to c:geo for additional support. Please let us know if you have further questions. Kindly, Janelle Geocaching Community Manager"

report.summary: Prepare homepage link changes in c:geo sources
report.label: None yet
report.description: We need to change some hyperlinks within c:geo as soon as we release the new webpage. IMO it would be good if someone can prepare a PR for this, so that we can merge it at a point of time when the website is ready. AFAIR we have quite some links to the FAQ in some message windows, in "About c:geo" and in statusupdate.java (closeout warning for 2.2) which need to be changed accordingly.

report.summary: Indicate the last time a cache was found / type of recent logs
report.label: None yet
report.description: My normal mode of operation for using c:geo is as follows: Use the map to find my area of interest. Scale the map to select an appropriate number of caches and store offline. Peruse the list for caches to target. Open the cache details Go to the logs and look at the recent ones to see when it was last found This is because where I live it isn't uncommon for a cache to go unfound for months and often the last years worth of logs are DNFs and/or needs maintenance. I usually will just skip these. It would be nice to have some sort of indication on the list page and/or the first details page of the last time cache was found and/or what the type of the last few logs are. My initial spit-ball of an implementation would be to have a colored/dashed line duplicating the colors from the last few log entries on the list page, one log per dash. Then that could be duplicated along with a last found date on the details page.

report.summary: Toggle "Stored in Device" between "X Days" and "the actual Date"
report.label: None yet
report.description: I suggest a "Toggle" (by pressing on the the text itself), between the approximate date and the actual date of "stored in device". This way the current functionality is also preserved. Detail: I use my "Stored in Device" date as a way of knowing when I actually "found" the cache. (which I then log from the geocaching.com website) I do this together with putting the cache into a "Found" List. So displaying the date, instead of the approximation, would be invaluable for me, so I don't have to figure out which day I was at the cache location.

report.summary: alternative control concept for cgeo
report.label: None yet
report.description: Yesterday it was cold (~0°C and windy). Since I don't have gloves for touchscreen use I got cold fingers while using cgeo - I don't like cold fingers. So thinking about how it could be possible to use cgeo with gloves the motion sensor came into my mind: For CacheDetailView: tend to the left / right ^= wipe to the left / right tend to the top / bottom ^= scroll up / down For Map: maybe we can add crosshairs which can be moved by tending the phone. to select fast move forward and back. But this can also be added later. For Lists / mainmenu: highlight the current selected item. move selection by tending the phone. select in the same way like map-select. Back: fast move left / right.

report.summary: In-app "Send message" (mail to owner)
report.label: None yet
report.description: When tapping on the owner name in the cache listing view, you can already call by context menu the Groundspeak web site to send a private message to the cache owner. While running with bad internet connection throw the forest and not liking to load a web page first, it would be nice to be able to type in the message content directly in the c:geo app and the app will automatically send it via Groundspeak to the owner. Also nice then, if the app will show a prefilled edit box with {cache owner name}, {cache name}, {GC code} and {my nick name} in the following format: Hello {cache owner name}, “{cache name}” ({GC code}). Regards, {my nick name} So you can directly post your concerns, without coping or typing boring standard content.

report.summary: exclude watchdog test from normal testing
report.label: None yet
report.description: I suggest we exclude the dedicated website tests (where each connector is tested one time) from normal unit testing. Benefit: Continuous integration testing on code changes is not affected by websites being down (e.g. OC.es right now). Drawback: We might take longer to notice parser issues after website changes, depending on how often we look at failing website tests.

report.summary: Performance issue caused by AsyncTask.execute
report.label: None yet
report.description: Developers of c:geo, I have found that AsyncTask.execute has been widely used in the project. However, this API is relatively slower on devices with system version higher than 3.0 because " AsyncTasks were executed serially on a single background thread" for systems newer than 3.0. (This is found in the API guide) While using c:geo, users can easily trigger multiple AsyncTasks and influence the performance, so I think it will help to improve the performance by changing execute to executeOnExecutor to enable real multi-thread execution. Thanks a lot.

report.summary: Add .mwm maps support (Maps.Me)
report.label: None yet
report.description: Just found out that despite c:geo has offline maps support, it doesn't work with native maps.me maps which are in .mwm format. Steps: Install maps.me download some areas for offline use make sure they were downloaded in .mwm run c:geo, point to the folder with downloaded map files make sure no new maps were added to c:geo It really makes sense, because it's the default use case - download some maps from the mobile maps app and then use it in c:geo.

report.summary: How to use mapsforge Themes and where to get them?
report.label: None yet
report.description: I know you are not the mapsforge support team, but you have the "Offline Maps" feature, which I use very often (especially abroad), so I think I'll ask here. I figured out a long time ago where to get the maps, but I still struggle on how to apply Themes to those maps. There are pages that provide mapsforge themes, but I got them never to work in c:geo. Is there a source for these themes or could you at least include a few more themes? Mapsforge (v0.6.1) does not include any other built-in themes than the default. I don't know how many users actually use this feature, but I think it would be more users if the feature was more "accessible". Some of the pages that give themes for free: http://www.openandromaps.org/en/legend/elevate-mountain-hike-theme http://openmaps.eu/mapsforgetheme Sidenote: I also found the thread (mentioned in the help here: http://www.cgeo.org/faq.html#osm-use-themes) where user @Lineflyer asks if he could use a theme, but most of the links seem to be dead: http://forum.locusmap.eu/index.php?topic=1753.0

report.summary: Proposal: Virtual lists for common challenge properties (Jasmer and DT grid)
report.label: None yet
report.description: The various challenges people set themselves or take up from challenge caches often drive people to seek out caches that would help satisfy the challenge If you look on project-gc.com you can see various grids and cache attributes and it's quite common for particularly nerdy cachers to want to collect all the boxes of those grids. Two of the most common are a) Filling all of the DT grid -- i.e. all 81 combinations of difficulty and terrain. Oncepl filled people look to repeat the cycle, i.e. fill it with numbers >= 2 and so on. b) filling the "Caches by hidden month" grid. The challenge caches for this are named after the person who first invented them "Jasmer". So you frequently see people talking about finding "Jasmers". I maintain a list called "Jasmer" which has any caches in areas I'm interested in that were hidden in a month that I'm currently missing on my Jasmer grid. However this has several problems. a) I can't store all the caches around the world this way so when I go to a new area I need to add more even if I'm not planning to do much caching and expecting to have data b) it's really hard to remove caches when I fill a spot. Removing dozens of caches from a lit based on an attribute that doesn't show in the listing is laborious and error prone and some of them may still be worth storing for other reasons but some may have had no other reason to be on the phone. What I would suggest instead is to keep an internal representation of the Jasmer grid and DT grid -- they're very small and easy to fetch from geocaching.com and/or project-gc but also fairly easy to just construct and update from stored information too. Then display an icon or word on the listing and on the cache detail page if the cache fits the property. It would be neat to provide a virtual list for these properties too which would display all stored caches that have the property. Then my workflow for most areas would be "store all caches in the area" then "display virtual list jasmer" choose my destinations based on that and then look at all stored caches in those areas.

report.summary: Feature: Add cache entry manually or semi-automated for offline-caching
report.label: None yet
report.description: Use Case: Base Members cannot add PMO caches to lists. On the other hand, BMs are allowed to log and sometimes have access to PMO listings, e.g. through a Premium Member colleague. Phase 1 could be to create a cache entry by entering GCCode, Name and Coords manually. Later some details could be retrieved automatically, e.g. owner, D/T rating. One way to get this information is nearby search. Currently the only way to enter PMO coordinates is to add a reference point to an already existing different cache.

report.summary: Database cleanup of orphaned records
report.label: None yet
report.description: Follow up from #6186 (comment). It turned out that due to the lack of foreign keys in the DB it happens that geocaches got deleted from cg_caches without their related records in dependent tables like cg_logs, cg_waypoints, ... The DataStore.cleanIfNeeded() is the housekeeping method which regulary (on startup) cleans up the database. This should be extended to also clean up these orphaned records as well.

report.summary: Create waypoints directly from the map view
report.label: None yet
report.description: I just swithed from WM10 where I was using maaloo geocaching. While I'm really impressed with all the features has, there is one I'm already missing very much. Like stated in the subiect, it woild be great to be able to create a waypoint by just taping and holding on the map. Use case: I view the cache I want to drive to and it doesn't have a parking waypoint. In the map view I can see an OSM marked parking near by (or any other object that could serve as a parking spot). I tap and hold on that spot and a "pin" or createn wew WPT menu appears From that menu I can either save it or select "Navigate" option (which I can use to pass the location e.g. to Google maps. I consider this feature useful because sometimes suitable parking places aren't always on the road closest to the target (therefore the navigation might not lead you to them if you navigate to the cache coordinates). Also, in an unfamiliar country it is best to be navigated straight to the parking as different signs and markings already add to the confusion. Regards WW

report.summary: Intermittent slowdown for loading nearby cache
report.label: None yet
report.description: Dear developers, We are applying our performance diagnosis tool PerfProbe to debug the response time for searching for nearby cache given a same address. Through repeated testing in an identical setup, we observe intermittent slowdown for the search result to be displayed (response time on average around 3.6 seconds and can increase to over 7 seconds). Through its system-wide profiling and tracing, PerfProbe discovers that the source of extra delay results from longer waiting time for server-side response. In particular, cgeo app is waiting for the response of two sequential HTTP GET request - one by GCLogin.getRequestLogged inside the method GCParser.searchByAny and another by GCVote.loadRatings inside the method SearchResult.filterSearchResults (with the detailed call chain CoordsGeocacheListLoader.apply -> GCConnector.searchByCenter -> GCParser.searchByCoords -> GCParser.searchByAny -> SearchResult.filterSearchResults). We hope the findings from our tool can be helpful for your debugging. We are also interested in helping improving the performance of this interaction. One suggestion to improve the latency that we can come up with is to batch the two HTTP requests in one network round trip - parallel HTTP request if they have no dependency or otherwise combine the response information of two requests together such that one new HTTP request is sufficient. Thank you very much for your attention and clarification! Detailed steps causing the problem: Step 1: click "Search" Step 2: enter address information under "Address" Step 3: click "Search by address" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Intermittently longer waiting time for the list of nearby geo caches to be loaded Expected behavior after performing these steps: A list of nearby geo caches are loaded Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.29 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Android version: Android 4.4.4 Device: Nexus 4

report.summary: Multiple cache IDs for send2cgeo
report.label: None yet

Closing these windows via JS on the client side seems not possible, because the time required until the request is handled is undefined and getting the result seems impossible due to CORS issues. Expected behavior after performing these steps: additional parameter for send2cgeo to handle a ; etc. delimited list of cache IDs

report.summary: Cache list styling
report.label: None yet
report.description: I've noticed a styling problem in the cache list. Caches that have a color marker on the left (found, etc) have the following differences from caches without this marker: cache icon is larger. (AFAIK cache icon is composed from multiple images, that of the cache type, that of the found, that of having waypoints) text is offset to right with the width of the border-left and a padding-left (without marker, there is no spacing for the marker width and padding-left=0) This creates a visually disturbing zig-zag effect. IMO cache type icons (with or without composition) should be the same size and the contents of the first column should be aligned at a constant position, leaving space for that marker where it is missing.

report.summary: Calculator Notes Cleanup
report.label: None yet
report.description: #6715, #6816 and #6821 are all addressing the calculator notes issue and all were closed before I was able to be involved with the changes, so I thought it would be best to open an issue of my own to provide input. As it stands the 'calculator notes' have been removed from the 'calculators state' but seem to be tagged onto the state externally with an 'ImmutablePair' object. In my mind if the notes field is essentially intended to be independent of the calculator itself it would be better to simply access the Waypoint's note data directly than tag it onto the calculator's state and kind of 'carry' them around together. I have an implementation of this and are mainly creating this issue so as to have a branch in which to commit this implementation.

Expected behavior after performing these steps: "Note" area which is usually read-only for imported waypoints is not visible because it makes no sense for user created waypoints. Version of c:geo used: 2017.11.05-NB-cc9328b Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: On demand. Other comments and remarks: Not sure if this was always the case.

report.summary: Add support to copy waypoint (user) notes
report.label: None yet
report.description: While using the waypoint calculator I wondered how I can share the variables gathered from stage to stage among the waypoints for easy transfer in the calculator formulas. My idea was to create a virtual waypoint called "Variables" to collect all stage variables in its user notes. From there I wanted to copy them into the stages' user notes. The user notes are also visible in the calculator so they can be copied in the variable values of the waypoint calculator. In the following screenshot you can see virtual waypoint "Variables" from where the variables were copied into the waypoints "Stage 2" and "Stage 4". Unfortunately there is no way to copy the user notes from a waypoint. 😮 I did a rough implementation that creates a new waypoint action "Copy Notes". This action strips HTML from the waypoint note, merges with user note and copies both into clipboard. Before I continue on the code I just wanted to ask in advance if there is interest and a chance to get this feature included.

report.summary: "Load more caches" does not always destroy the initial loader
report.label: None yet
report.description: Same as #5498 but for other actions like "Caches around". This somehow slipped through because I thought that "Nearby" action is the same as "Caches around". Only the way how the start coordinates are determined is different. But in fact, there are two different loader types: CacheListType.NEAREST (fixed in #5498) CacheListType.COORDINATE (still truncates list to 40) Fix should be trivial. I will handle it.

report.summary: Waypoint Calculator: Support for float results
report.label: None yet
report.description: See formuia in GC7ENZJ. North 48° ((B * D) +((D+E+A+B+C+F+G+H) * C)) *A East 011° (E+D) * A * B Result of both formulas is something like 23456. There is no possibility to "float-divide" by 1000 to get 23.456. The only way to achieve the desired result is to repeat both formulas once with "/ 1000" and once with "% 1000", e.g. in plain mode: N 48° (((B*D) + ((D+E+A+B+C+F+G+H)*C)) * A / 1000).(((B*D) + ((D+E+A+B+C+F+G+H)*C)) * A % 1000) E 011° ((E+D) * A * B / 1000).((E+D) * A * B % 1000) Needless to say that this is cumbersome.
